sourceMeaningMnemonic: To a <radical>narwhal</radical>, a <radical>towel</radical> is just normal <kanji>cloth</kanji>. They're always wet so towel cloth is all they know.
meaningInfo: Picture a narwhal wrapped in a fuzzy towel blanket, with a towel tail cover, and some towel underpants. Everything is made of this type of cloth.
readingMnemonic: If you use this type of <kanji>cloth</kanji> for your clothes and blankets people will call you a <reading>foo</reading>l (<ja>ふ</ja>). They think you're a fool who can't tell the difference between human cloth and towel cloth.
readingInfo: "You fool, you aren't a narwhal, that cloth isn't for you!" they say. They're so mean.
